defs: = ಗಬ್ಬಗರ.
to bring down another's undue pride, arrogance etc.
to lose belief in one's own abilities, confidence, etc.; to become diffident.
to become humble; to sub-due or eschew one's pride; to be modest.
irrational governance; indiscreet, injudicious, imprudent management.
arrogant; haughty; headstrong.
a man of inordinate pride or arrogance; a haughty man.
excessiveness; abundance.
a man of esteem.
an arrogant, haughty woman.
a man of high social status.
a strong man.
the headgear used to control a horse, consisting of buckled leather straps, a metal bit, and reins; a bridle.
the quality of being arrogant, inordinately proud; arrogance; undue pride.
any mouse-like nocturnal mammal of the order Chiroptera, capable of flight by means of membranous wings extending from its forelimbs; a bat.
= ಗಬ್ಬಿಲ.
a strong, offensive smell or odour; stink; stench.
any dirty, stinking material.
= ಗಬ್ಬ2.
the tree Gironniera cuspidata ( = G. reticulata) of Ulmaceae family, whose wood emits a very offensive smell; hellish incense.
a youthful woman.
the tree Acacia latronum of Mimosae family.
the insect, Dysdercus cingulatus; a cotton stainer; a red-bug.
to give off a strong, unpleasant smell; to emit stench; to stink.
the plant Tridax procumbens of Asteraceae family.

to become stinking.

the sun.

the sun.
a ring of light that seems to encircle the sun, resulted from the refraction of light through ice crystals in our atmosphere; halo.
the sun.
extending down, inward, etc. considerably; very deep.
deeply or intensely felt; being so.
not inclined to flirt; not given to fun, cheap amusement; restrained in speech, action, etc.; dignified; decent.
solemn; deeply earnest.

that cannot easily or superficially be understood; of, containing, implying or characterised by mystery; that which requires serious thought, study, etc.; intellectually profound; marked by intellectual depth; serious; grave.
inspiring awe or admiration through grandeur, beauty, etc.; sublime; stately; majestic.
sounding grave, solemn (said of a person's voice).
of or in the octaves lower than the normal one (i.e. below the middle C).

a sober man; a man of serious thought, action, etc.
the quality or fact of being deep (usu. being difficult to measure the depth).
the quality or condition of being difficult to grasp or comprehend.
the solemn feeling, character or appearance; serious or awesome quality; solemnity; gravity.

a deep, heavy or solemn sound.

the quality of acting or doing suddenly with little thought; rashness; impulsiveness; impetuousness.
lack of full knowledge.

impressing upon the mind; making clear or intelligible; convincing.

the quality of being worthy of esteem or honour; dignified manner, style, etc.; elegance.
the condition of being enthusiastic or thrilled.
a reciting of poetry melodiously, using musical modes suitable to the sentiments of the situation in the poetry, and depicting the meaning lucidly.
the act or process of giving moral or religious advice; a counselling.

one who preaches or advices.
(gram.) a kind of compound of words in which the former word is a number, pronoun, adjective or noun formed from a verb.
the enhancing of the beauty of a musical note by moving or oscillating it around its natural position in a regulated manner.
the art of reciting of poetry melodiously, using musical modes suitable to the sentiments of the situation in the poetry, and depicting the meaning lucidly.
to add fragrance to; to make (something) fragrant.
to become elegant, beautiful.
(collectively) seven kinds of gamakas, i.e. artful regulation of the movement of a particular musical note around its natural position, that adds to the melody.
a person who recites poetry using appropriate musical modes and depicts the idea of the poetry in a limpid manner.

to act in a reckless haste with little or no thought.
the quality of being elegant; dignified richness and grace; polished fastidiousness or refined grace.

to be fragrant; to emit or be emitting a sweet smell.

a very offensive smell.
a sweet, pleasing smell; a fragrance; a pleasant odour.
the act of going, moving, walking.
manner of moving, walking; gait.

attention - a) the act of keeping one's mind closely on something or the ability to do this; mental concentration; b) mental readiness for such concentration; c) notice; observation; d) care or consideration.

ಗಮನ ಸೆಳೆ gamana seḷe to deliberately draw another's attention (to a particular subject); ಗಮನ ಸೆಳೆಯುವ ಸೂಚನೆ gamana seḷeyuva sūcane a motion, in a legislative house, to draw the attention of the chairperson and the house to an urgent matter that is not in the normal agenda for discussion; a draw-attention motion.
a person so dreamy or lost in thought as not to pay attention to what one is doing or what is going on around one; an absent-minded person.
the quality or condition of being lost in thought resulting in what is going on around oneself is not able to draw his or her attention.
(Jain.) an act of self-punishment or a penance observed for having probably killed or injured insects while walking.
(mus.) the fifty-third of the seventy two main modes in Karnāṭaka system.
the act of going and coming.
the act of strolling; usual or leisurely walk.

a large, opaque, non-luminous mass, usu. with its own moons, that revolves about a star; esp., any of the sun's nine major planets: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, and Pluto; a planet.
(astrol.) any of the nine planets (the sun, moon, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, Saturn, Rāhu and Kētu) which are supposed to influence and control the life of all human beings.

(dance.) one of the twenty three postures.

a tall stone pillar, with bells at the top, erected in front of a temple (usu. of Viṣṇu).
a stone pillar planted in memory of a person who committed suicide following his masteṛs death.
a pillar (to which the accused person would be tied) in front of a village office where, in the erstwhile system, the accused persons were tried.

the fifth day of Śrāvaṇa, the fifth month in Hindu lunar calendar.
a festival observed on this day.

a Garuḍa, Brahminee kite.
an arrow shot with a mystic hymns that was believed to counteract the effect of an arrow shot by one's enemy, that would inflict the snake venom.

the plant Rauwolfia serpentina ( = Ophioxylon serpentinum) of Apocynaceae family, the reserpine, an alkaloid extracted from the roots of which is used as a sedative in treating hypochondria, insomnia, insanity.

a hook used to catch and pick up things from under water, that is deep.

one of eighteen sacred scriptures (purāṇas) of Hindus, dealing with obsequies.

a nose that is curved like a hook; aquiline nose.
the plant Martynia annua of Martyniaceae family; tigeṛs nail plant.

Viṣṇu, whose vehicle is Garuḍa, the king of birds.
